intro: Ischnosiphon surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam thornapple, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap and spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and medicinal contexts.
